4 Methods to Remove Stinky Odors from Clothing Posted on
4 Methods to Remove Stinky Odors from Clothing Storing clothing in the off season is a wonderful way to save space and only have out what you actually wear. However, storing clothing can also mean that your clothing may retain a musty smell. Clothing can also retain odor from smoke, mold, mildew, heavy food odors, and the like. We all want to wear clothing that is fresh smelling so being able to get out those offensive smells is important. There are four different methods that you can use to remove heavy odor from clothing. Try these tips for help. Fill washing machine with hot or warm water and your normal laundry detergent. Add in the stinky clothing. Once the washer has completely filled up with water, add in 1 cup of baking soda. Turn off your washer and let the items soak for an hour. Turn washer back on and let it run as you normally would. Repeat process if needed. Fill washing machine with hot or warm water and your normal laundry detergent. Add in your stinky clothing. Pour in 1/2 of a cup of white vinegar. Turn off the washer and let the items soak for one hour. Turn washer back on and let it run as you normally would. Repeat the process if needed. These days you can find several different commercial products out in the retail market that are specifically made for removing odors from your clothing. Some of these products work better than others and some only work on certain types of fabrications. Read labels before purchasing and follow the package directions carefully when using these products. If your items have a light odor to them you can try a fabric refreshening type of spray. Several companies make them and you can find them in the laundry aisle at your grocery store. These products are best for “very light” odors and not heavy duty stink smells! If the spray does not work well, try step one or two.
You can also treat your clothing before storing it away for the next season too. It can reduce the storage smells your clothing may get. Give it a try! This entry was posted in Blogs . Bookmark the permalink . Leave a Reply You must be logged in to post a comment.
